itemListElement.name: Home
Breakfast Recipes
Stuffed Pretzels filled with sauteed Cremini Mushrooms and green beans. vegan ,glutenfree option

@graph.name: Stuffed Pretzels
@graph.description: Stuffed pretzels with sauteed cremini mushrooms and green beans. A delicious and fun snack for game day! Vegan Recipe Gluten Free Option.
recipeYield: 8 -10 pretzels (makes 6, 3 inch fat pretzels. you can make 8-10 if you roll them thinner)
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon raw sugar or other natural sugar/sweetener
3 Tablespoons non dairy yogurt (I used SoDelicious plain yogurt)
Kosher or sea salt for sprinkling
2 tablespoons baking soda mixed in 6 cups of water for boiling pretzels in.
1/4 teaspoon chili flakes or to taste

itemListElement.text: In a pan, add oil and heat on low. Add mushrooms and cook covered for 3-4 minutes.
itemListElement.name: In a pan, add oil and heat on low. Add mushrooms and cook covered for 3-4 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Add green beans, salt and chili flakes or black pepper. Mix and cook covered for 5-7 minutes until mushrooms start to brown.
itemListElement.name: Add green beans, salt and chili flakes or black pepper. Mix and cook covered for 5-7 minutes until mushrooms start to brown.

itemListElement.text: In a bowl, add warm water, yeast and sugar. Mix well and let it get frothy. 5-7 minutes.
itemListElement.name: In a bowl, add warm water, yeast and sugar. Mix well and let it get frothy. 5-7 minutes.

itemListElement.text: In another bowl, mix in the flours and salt well. Add to yeast mixture.
itemListElement.name: In another bowl, mix in the flours and salt well. Add to yeast mixture.

itemListElement.text: Add oil and yogurt and knead into a soft non sticky dough. 3-4 minutes. Add a smidgen more yogurt if needed.
itemListElement.name: Add oil and yogurt and knead into a soft non sticky dough. 3-4 minutes. Add a smidgen more yogurt if needed.

itemListElement.text: Place dough in greased container, Spritz top with water, cover and let rise for 2 hours or until doubled.
itemListElement.name: Place dough in greased container, Spritz top with water, cover and let rise for 2 hours or until doubled.

itemListElement.text: Take dough out, knead for a minute then roll out into a rectangle.
itemListElement.name: Take dough out, knead for a minute then roll out into a rectangle.

itemListElement.text: Sprinkle the filling on the rectangle and roll it like a jelly roll from the long side.
itemListElement.name: Sprinkle the filling on the rectangle and roll it like a jelly roll from the long side.

itemListElement.text: Stick the edge with a little water.
itemListElement.name: Stick the edge with a little water.

itemListElement.text: Roll the jelly roll between your hands to make it thinner like a rope as much as possible.
itemListElement.name: Roll the jelly roll between your hands to make it thinner like a rope as much as possible.

itemListElement.text: Cut the rope into equal pieces and seal the ends.
itemListElement.name: Cut the rope into equal pieces and seal the ends.

itemListElement.text: Alternatively, you can divide the dough into balls and roll each one out, add filling and shape into about 2 inch long cylinder pretzel.
itemListElement.name: Alternatively, you can divide the dough into balls and roll each one out, add filling and shape into about 2 inch long cylinder pretzel.
Place these on parchment.

itemListElement.text: Bring 1.5-2 quart (6-8 cups) water in a deep pan to a boil. Add the baking soda.(water quantity Depends on size of your pan)
itemListElement.name: Bring 1.5-2 quart (6-8 cups) water in a deep pan to a boil. Add the baking soda.(water quantity Depends on size of your pan)

itemListElement.text: Boil the pretzels in the water for 30 seconds or so till they rise on their own.
itemListElement.name: Boil the pretzels in the water for 30 seconds or so till they rise on their own.

itemListElement.text: Remove from water and place back on parchment lined sheet. Sprinkle and press salt on the tops.(I dint have kosher, and the table salt is not visible in the pictures:))
itemListElement.name: Remove from water and place back on parchment lined sheet. Sprinkle and press salt on the tops.(I dint have kosher, and the table salt is not visible in the pictures:))

itemListElement.text: Once all pretzels are on parchment, bake in preheated 400 degrees F oven for 12-15 minutes, until golden.(depends on size of pretzel. smaller ones take less time)
itemListElement.name: Once all pretzels are on parchment, bake in preheated 400 degrees F oven for 12-15 minutes, until golden.(depends on size of pretzel. smaller ones take less time)

itemListElement.text: Let them rest for 5 minutes before serving with any favorite dip like vegan ranch or hummus or vegan honey mustard!
itemListElement.name: Let them rest for 5 minutes before serving with any favorite dip like vegan ranch or hummus or vegan honey mustard!

@graph.keywords: game day food, mushroom pretzels, vegan bagels
